name: Logger
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger
description:
Logger

A (mostly) API-compatible logger for ruby’s Logger.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

resource = logging.resource "gae_app",
                            module_id: "1",
                            version_id: "20150925t173233"

logger = logging.logger "my_app_log", resource, env: :production
logger.info "Job started."

methods.name: writer
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#writer
methods.description: The Google Cloud writer object that calls to #write_entries are made on. Either an AsyncWriter or Project object.

methods.name: log_name
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#log_name
methods.description: The Google Cloud log_name to write the log entry with.

methods.name: resource
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#resource
methods.description: The Google Cloud resource to write the log entry with.

methods.name: labels
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#labels
methods.description: The Google Cloud labels to write the log entry with.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

writer = logging.async_writer max_queue_size: 1000

resource = logging.resource "gae_app", labels: {
                              "module_id" => "1",
                              "version_id" => "20150925t173233" }
                            }

logger = Google::Cloud::Logging::Logger.new writer,
                                            "my_app_log",
                                            resource,
                                            env: :production
logger.info "Job started."

params.name: writer
params.description:
The object that will transmit log
entries. Generally, to create a logger that blocks on transmitting
log entries, pass the Project; otherwise, to create a logger that
transmits log entries in the background, pass an AsyncWriter. You
may also pass any other object that responds to #write_entries.

params.name: log_name
params.description:
A log resource name to be associated with the
written log entries.

params.name: resource
params.description:
The monitored
resource to be associated with written log entries.

params.name: labels
params.description:
A set of user-defined data to be associated with
written log entries.

returns.description:
a Logger object that can be
used in place of a ruby standard library logger object.

params.name: message
params.description:
The log entry payload, represented as
either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

params.name: yield
params.description:
Evaluates to the message to log. This is not evaluated unless
the logger’s level is sufficient to log the message. This allows you
to create potentially expensive logging messages that are only
called when the logger is configured to show them.

params.name: message
params.description:
The log entry payload, represented as
either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

params.name: yield
params.description:

the logger’s level is sufficient to log the message. This allows you
to create potentially expensive logging messages that are only
called when the logger is configured to show them.

methods.name: unknown
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#unknown
methods.description: Log an UNKNOWN entry. This will be printed no matter what the logger’s current severity level is.

params.name: message
params.description:
The log entry payload, represented as
either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

params.name: yield
params.description:
Evaluates to the message to log. This is not evaluated unless
the logger’s level is sufficient to log the message. This allows you
to create potentially expensive logging messages that are only
called when the logger is configured to show them.

methods.name: add
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#add
methods.description: Log a message if the given severity is high enough. This is the generic logging method. Users will be more inclined to use #debug, #info, #warn, #error, and #fatal.

params.name: severity
params.description:
the integer code for or the
name of the severity level

params.name: message
params.description:
The log entry payload, represented as
either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

params.name: yield
params.description:
Evaluates to the message to log. This is not evaluated unless
the logger’s level is sufficient to log the message. This allows you
to create potentially expensive logging messages that are only
called when the logger is configured to show them.

methods.name: debug?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#debug?
methods.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending DEBUG messages.

methods.name: info?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#info?
methods.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending INFO messages.

methods.name: warn?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#warn?
methods.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending WARN messages.

methods.name: error?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#error?
methods.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending ERROR messages.

methods.name: fatal?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Logger#fatal?
methods.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending FATAL messages.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

resource = logging.resource "gae_app",
                            module_id: "1",
                            version_id: "20150925t173233"

logger = logging.logger "my_app_log", resource, env: :production

logger.level = "INFO"
logger.debug "Job started." # No log entry written

params.name: severity
params.description:
the integer code for or the
name of the severity level
